Due To The Covid-19 Pandemic, 

Wallbank Home Inspections Have Implemented The Government of Canada COVID-19 Recommendations To Our Normal Process Of A Home Inspection To Ensure The Health & Safety Of Our Home Inspectors, Clients, Friends & Family.

We At Wallbank Home Inspections Take Your Safety Seriously, Our Inspectors Wear New Masks, Gloves & Sanitize All Equipment Prior & After Leaving Your Home.
Our Inspectors Are Double Vaccinated + Booster, Experienced, Detailed & Provide First Class Customer Service.

We Respect Your Privacy, Your Family And Your Home, We Also Remove Our Boots At The Front Door! 

We Keep Our Findings In Perspective, The Inspection Usually Lasts 2 1/2 Hours, It Will Consist Of Physically Inspecting And Reporting On The Condition Of The Systems And Components Of The Home. This Consists Of The Structural Foundation, Roof, Exterior, Electrical, Heating & Cooling, Plumbing, Insulation, Ventilation, And Interior Of The Home.

We Love Questions! Lets Discuss Your Next Project!

Thank You For Visiting,

Wallbank Home Inspections

profile: Dive Deep Home Inspections is a residential home inspection company made up of Certified Home Inspectors who have residential construction and renovation experience. Inspectors who know how the systems of your home should actually function. Your home is the largest investment you will make in you lifetime. Whether you are just looking to buy, preparing to sell the one you have, or maybe just looking to make sure its well maintained, let us have a look. Dive Deep Home Inspections only works with Certified Home Inspectors who have past residential construction or renovation experience. We know homes from the ground up. A proper home inspection, sometimes called a Field Performance Review, consists of a visual inspection and tests using the standard operating controls, of the major systems in your home. Systems which include roofing, structure, exterior, interior and insulation, plumbing, electrical, and of course your heating and air conditioning. Don't trust such a detailed inspection to just anyone. Our certified and experienced inspectors know how these systems should function. All inspections are documented in a report, that includes full colour pictures, and diagrams and links that help you to understand your inspectors findings. Your report comes to you by email within 24 hours and you will have access to your inspectors for as long as you need for questions and/or explanations. Let us Dive Deep into your home!

profile:
Who We Are
Having completed over 4000 Home Inspections, Durham Home Inspection is a Certified and fully insured Home Inspection firm providing clients with thorough and professional services. Ensuring you are completely prepared and understand the condition of the home is our focus. Our on-site reporting system includes digital pictures of current issues and recommendations. Clients are also provided with a home owner's guide to fully understanding the maintenance of their home. We utilize an interactive approach and involve the client in the process. Trust your purchase with Durham Home Inspection.


Complete Residential and Tarion Home Inspections
Safeguard your property investment with a home inspection from Durham Home Inspection. We have completed over 3500 Home Inspections, providing professional and detailed reporting allowing you to make an informed decision. Trust the experience of Durham Home Inspection.
		
			
Residential Home Inspections
Save yourself the time, effort, and expense of home repairs with a home inspection. Using a proven method, we give your home a complete evaluation. We follow the Standards of Practice of the National Association of Certified Home Inspectors and can be viewed here.
We also build an electronic report on-site that includes pictures of all defects along with recommendations on repairs. For your convenience, we review the report on-site and e-mail you a copy of it that same day. Our complete review of your home and visual inspection of all its systems includes:
• Electrical
• Plumbing	• Heating
• Structure	• Roof
• Attic Spaces	• Exterior
• Landscape
Tarion Home Inspections.
Identify any problems with your new home with a Tarion™ new home warranty inspection from Durham Home Inspection. We do a thorough check prior to the expiration of the warranty to reveal any builder related issues. After our inspection, we provide a detailed report with digital images of any issues to convey to the Tarion New Home Warranty Program. We also educate to home owner on preventative measures to help avoid problems in the future.
Benefits
The benefits of a home inspection are that you receive valuable information on the condition of the house, including its issues. With the information, you can make an informed decision regarding the purchase of the house. A home inspection also provides you with valuable information about how to manage the different systems in the home along with strategies to avoid problems in the future.
 
Contact us for thorough home inspections that give you peace of mind about the quality of your real estate investment.
services: From top to bottom home inspection.
specialities:
Homeowners who take the time to complete some simple jobs in winter can reduce or eliminate costly repairs down the road. The following easy steps will help contribute to your comfort and energy efficiency while reducing future repairs.
1. Monitor basement humidity and avoid low relative humidity levels. Use a humidifier to maintain safe, 
    relative humidity.
2. Examine your attic for frost accumulation. Check your roof for ice dams or icicles.
3. Vacuum your fire and smoke detectors, because dust or spider webs can prevent them from functioning.
4. Check electrical cords, plugs, and outlets for all indoor and outdoor seasonal lights to ensure fire safety. 
    If worn or the plugs or cords feel warm to the touch, replace them immediately.
5. Clean your humidifier two or three times during the winter season.
6. Examine windows and doors for ice accumulation or cold air leaks. If any problems are found, make a 
    note to repair or replace the windows or doors in the spring.
7. For more useful tips, visit the CMHC website.

profile:
Final Say Home Inspection is owned and operated by Paul Christensen, Rhi, NCI, a formally trained and qualified home inspector. 
Paul is a Register Home Inspector with OAHI (Ontario Association of Home Inspectors) and has been involved in new house construction and renovations for over 40 years. The breadth of his knowledge and skill levels can be attributed to the on-site training received from generations of family members involved in trades covering nearly all aspects of residential construction. Adding to his understanding of traditional building techniques, Paul undertook a number of courses that consolidated his familiarity with current building codes and practices. He earned his Home Inspection Certificate at Durham College Oshawa and completed several Ontario Building Code courses at Durham College Whitby, passed the CAHPI (Canadian Association of Home and Property Inspectors) examination and has completed New Construction Inspection training program.
Paul brings years of design, inspection and evaluation experience to home inspection and is committed to providing the best service to his customers.
 
A Final Say Home Inspection is a professional and thorough visual analysis of the property, both inside and out.  Final Say conducts a fair and impartial investigation resulting in a clear, fact-filled analysis of the building, outlining strengths, deficiencies and maintenance recommendations.  Every inspection we perform exceeds national industry standards.
Home inspections are one of the most effective ways to ensure that you are making both a sound structural investment and a sound financial investment.  A proper pre-purchase home inspection by a qualified and certified home inspector can help ensure that both your future home and investment are safe.  We protect you against loss. We have been involved in the construction trade for over 40 years and know home inspection inside out.  Unlike many home inspection companies, our inspectors are all trained to the highest standards and have in-depth knowledge and experience.
New home buyers can also protect their investment by having a New Home Warranty Inspection done on their home.  Final Say Inspectors have taken special training developed by CAHPI (Canadian Association of Home and Property Inspectors) for New Construction Inspection as it pertains to Ontario homes.  This program was developed after consultation with Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation and Ontario Home Builders Association
name: Final Say Home Inspection

profile:
Buying a home is a very important decision.....
Take no chances!
   
Buying a home is probably the single most important purchase you will ever make! My goal at Accurate Home Inspections is to give you as much information as possible to make an informed decision when buying a home.
Choosing a home inspector within the limited time constraints and deadlines is not easy and timing is most often critical. I understand the importance of a timely home inspection, so I am  available seven days a week. Same day inspections are often possible. I encourage you to accompany me during the 2-3 hour visit. Your participation during the inspection process is important. 

While there is no current regulation or licencing provisions for home inspectors in the Province of Ontario there are, unfortunately, some home inspectors that claim to be Licensed Home Inspectors. Nothing could be further from the truth. Take the time to confirm any home inspector's qualifications before considering them for your home inspection.
This is no time to look for a cheap inspection!
My Home Inspector Qualifications

Pickering Home Inspections
I have more that 25 years experience in home renovations, repair and maintenance. I am a full time inspector and I have inspected homes for more than 2,500 satisfied customers since 2005.  You can be assured that I have the skill and knowledge to provide you with the quality inspection and report you deserve.  

Experience is not expensive, it's priceless!

I am one of the few home inspectors in this area who has earned two of the industry’s highest professional designations: 

Certified Master Inspector, CMI.         
National Home Inspector, NHI.
name: Accurate Home Inspection Services Inc.

profile:
Buying or selling a home is a big decision and event in your family’s life. Likely the most expensive decision you will ever make. The experience can be daunting, for even the seasoned veteran, leaving you to feel that you are on a road journey by yourself. Even buying a “new” build home can present a big bump in the road. CSS Inspections ensures you are not alone on this journey, that you are prepared and equipped, working to have “No Surprises”.

It is our goal to assist with this journey, to make the road straight, to reduce the confusion and risk. We believe our services help to educate our clients, enabling people to make a more informed decision. Utilizing our years worth of home repairs, renovation, attention to detail, helps you, the customer, to reduce your risk and to understand issues. We will take the time to explain without unnecessary drama, “just the facts”, clearly discussing what options you have.
